author: Tanveer Mann
title: How London Terror attack survivors got away from attacker Khalid Masood
text:
Four people were killed and more than 40 others were injured after a car ploughed into pedestrians on Westminster Bridge at 2.40pm on Wednesday. (Picture: Universal News And Sport (Europe)) Survivors caught up in the Westminster terror attack and their family and friends have revealed how they managed to get away during Wednesday’s attack. 
Muslims donate over £20,000 for victims of London terror attack Four people were killed and more than 40 others were injured after a car ploughed into pedestrians on Westminster Bridge at 2.40pm on Wednesday.
The attacker, named as Adrian Elms but used the name Khalid Masood at the time of the attack, drove at the pedestrians before crashing his hire car and stabbing to death Pc Keith Palmer at the gates to the Houses of Parliament.
Francisco Lopes, 26 
Francisco Lopes, 26, was left with serious leg injuries after being hit by the attacker’s car on Wednesday in Westminster. (Picture: AP Photo) Francisco Lopes, 26, was left with serious leg injuries after being hit by the attacker’s car on Wednesday in Westminster.
Sick terror guides ‘telling extremists how to use a car to crush victims found online’ The 26-year-old said he felt ‘scared for my life’ when he was knocked to the floor as he walked home from a shift at a shop in St Thomas’ hospital.
Mr Lopes said: ‘He started to move towards the pedestrian pavement and started to just take out the people that were in front of the car, so, literally when I realised this, the car was literally just about one metre away, so I had no, literally, no time to get out of the way.
‘Basically what I did, I just tried to defend myself as I could. So I put my arms forward, and the car just tumbled me over and that was it basically.’

He found himself on the pavement surrounded by screaming victims, after Masood left a trail of destruction which has so far claimed four lives.
‘The adrenaline just started to take over me, I didn’t want to die so I was just like “yeah, I’m going to be okay, I’m going to try to convince myself that I’m going to be okay” and that my legs were going to be okay,’ he said.
‘I was horrified because I was scared for my life, you know, I said I didn’t want to die.’
The victims Pc Keith Palmer – A 48-year-old father stabbed by Khalid Masood. He was once nominated as ‘best thief-taker’ for making 150 arrests in a year
Leslie Rhodes – A 75-year-old man from Streatham, South London, who died last night after his life support was turned off in hospital
Aysha Frade – A 43-year-old mother-of-two who worked for a sixth-form who was hit by the killer’s car and then thrown under a bus
Kurt Cochran – A 54-year-old husband from Utah celebrating the 25th anniversary of his wedding to wife Melissa, who was badly injured
Mr Lopes, who has lived in London for 15 years, had surgery on his legs and hands after being rushed to hospital. (Picture: PA Wire)

Mr Lopes, who has lived in London for 15 years, had surgery on his legs and hands after being rushed to hospital.
He hailed the paramedics as ‘fantastic’, but said he was still haunted by the experience.
‘I’m happy to be alive but sleep is more difficult, difficult because I see the car hitting me, I see it all the time so it’s difficult to sleep,’ he said.
Travis Frain, from Lancashire 
Travis Frain, 19, was rushed to hospital after he was hit by the car (Picture: Getty Images) Travis Frain, 19, was caught up in the attack outside of the Houses of Parliament and suffered a severed groin as well as fractures to his left arm and a leg, a cracked rib, and deep cuts to his foot.
Fourth London Terror attack victim named as Leslie Rhodes The 19-year-old, a political activist and president of Edge Hill University Conservative Association, had been on a two-day field trip travelling with 13 other students when the group decided to take a break for some air.
Only a matter of seconds later, the tragic attack unfolded before his eyes as a 4×4 car mounted the kerb.
The 19-year-old, a political activist and president of Edge Hill University Conservative Association, had been on a two-day field trip travelling with 13 other students (Picture: Ross Parry) His father, Patrick Frain, 55, from Darwen, Lancashire, said: ‘We didn’t hear from Travis after the attack until 10pm last night. It was my wife Angela who took the call and I was sick. Since then we have been waiting and waiting for news.
‘He was taken straight to King’s College Hospital and it was the police who called us first to let us know he was involved in the attack and was okay.
‘He had severed part of his groin, fractured some bones and injured his knee, which he needs surgery for.
Travis stood as a Conservative candidate in last April’s Blackburn with Darwen Borough Council elections, finishing second in Sunnyhurst ward with 337 votes. (Picture: PA) Travis stood as a Conservative candidate in last April’s Blackburn with Darwen Borough Council elections, finishing second in Sunnyhurst ward with 337 votes.
Patrick said: ‘He’d left the parliament buildings with some friends to get fresh air and was walking over the bridge when the attack happened.
‘My wife took the 2pm train down to London yesterday to be with him and he was due to go into theatre just after 12pm so he’s likely to be groggy.’

Emergency services transport an injured person to an ambulance, close to the Houses of Parliament in London on Wednesday (Picture: AP) Thomas, from Brittany, France 
Thomas was one of three pupils injured as they walked along the bridge during a school trip to London.
How to explain the Westminster terror attack to children He suffered a head injury and fractures to his legs during the attack.
His mother told Brittany website Le Telegramme: ‘It was the school who told us Wednesday afternoon that the attack had taken place and our son was one of the victims.’
The mother of one of said she thought he was dead for an hour before being told he was injured.

The students, aged between 15 and 16, were pupils from Lycee Saint-Joseph de Concarneau, Brittany.
They were named as Victor and Yann and all been travelling together in a party of around 90.
André Fidelin, the Mayor of Concarneau, said it was the second time in as many years that the school had been hit by terrorism.
In November 2015, former St Joseph’s pupil Estelle Rouat, 25, was in the Bataclan concert hall in Paris when it was turned into a bloodbath by Islamic State suicide bombers.
MORE: #PrayForLondon: Don’t judge those who share hashtags and the Union flag in aftermath of Westminster terror attack 
The attacker was shot dead by police after he stabbed Pc Keith Palmer to death (Picture: Getty Images) Estelle, who was working as an English teacher, was murdered alongside 88 others as she attended a concert by the American band Eagles of Death Metal.
Mr Fidelin, the mayor, said: ‘It’s terrible, because a psychosis is likely to set in at the school because it has already been affected by terrorism.
‘Our emotion is intense. Concarneau is again touched by terror and horror, and we can not imagine the anguish and anxiety of the parents.
What happened outside Parliament? Members of the emergency services work to help vicitms on Westminster Bridge, alongside the Houses of Parliament in central London on March 22, 2017, during an emergency incident (Picture: Getty) A massive police investigation is under way after a terror attack in central London.
Here’s everything we know so far about the Westminster attack: 
Five people have died – a police officer, the attacker, a woman named as Aysha Frade, 43, US tourist Kurt Cochran and 75-year-old Leslie Rhodes succumbed to his injuries in hospital a day after the attack.
The officer was Pc Keith Palmer, a 48-year-old husband and father with 15 years of police service.
A minute’s silence was held at 9.33am to honour Palmer, whose police shoulder number was 933. 
Nine people have been arrested and six addresses raided across London, Birmingham and elsewhere.
The woman was killed on Westminster Bridge as a number of pedestrians were mowed down by a grey Hyundai i40.
It is believed the man was also killed in the incident on the bridge.
Seven people are in a critical condition, and 29 have been treated in hospital.
One woman ended up in the Thames and was treated for serious injuries after being pulled from the water.
The attacker, has been named as Khalid Masood by police, although he used several alias.
Armed with two large knives, he jumped out of the car after smashing it into the railings encircling the Palace of Westminster, fatally stabbing Pc Palmer as he entered the grounds.
He was shot dead moments later by another officer.
Theresa May told MPs he was a ‘peripheral’ figure, adding: ‘He was not part of the current intelligence picture.’
